body:
I had the same issue one week ago, but I just run again "brew install --cask powershell" and the installation is succeeding now.

```
~ brew install --cask powershell                                                                                                                              
==> Tapping homebrew/cask
Cloning into '/usr/local/Homebrew/Library/Taps/homebrew/homebrew-cask'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 2, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (2/2), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done.
remote: Total 577623 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 577621
Receiving objects: 100% (577623/577623), 240.76 MiB | 15.35 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (411157/411157), done.
Tapped 1 command and 3752 casks (3,871 files, 259MB).
==> Downloading https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.1.0/powershell-7.1.0-osx-x64.pkg
==> Downloading from https://github-production-release-asset-2e65be.s3.amazonaws.com/49609581/53dced00-2377-11eb-9e04-9458ce3dd8ce?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Credential=AKIAIWN
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Installing Cask powershell
==> Running installer for powershell; your password may be necessary.
==> Package installers may write to any location; options such as --appdir are ignored.
installer: Package name is PowerShell - 7.1.0
installer: Installing at base path /
installer: The install was successful.
ðŸº  powershell was successfully installed!
```

Not working for me today when VS Code says it needs to update PowerShell.

```
=====> PowerShell Integrated Console v2021.12.0 <=====

PS /path/to/my/jive> brew upgrade --cask powershell
Error: Cask 'powershell' is unavailable: No Cask with this name exists.
```

Same issue if I try in Terminal directly.

Is there a way to bypass the cask, which, iirc, is sorta like a recipe, and install directly from the URLs? I'm no homebrew wiz.

```
==> Downloading https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.1.0/powershell-7.1.0-osx-x64.pkg
==> Downloading from https://github-production-release-asset-2e65be.s3.amazonaws.com/49609581/53dced00-2377-11eb-9e04-9458ce3dd8ce?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Credential=AKIAIWN
```

But seriously, folks, no love since December 3? This is an absolute show-stopper for running latest `pwsh` on macOS. Who do we need to @?
